description: Smallest prime factor of 1 + (product of first n primes).
comments: Based on Euclid's proof that there are infinitely many primes.
links: M. Kraitchik, On the divisibility of factorials, Scripta Math., 14 (1948), 24-26 (but beware errors). [Annotated scanned copy]
Hisanori Mishima, Factorizations of many number sequences
Hisanori Mishima, Factorizations of many number sequences
R. G. Wilson v, Explicit factorizations
maple: a:= proc(n)local N, F, i;  N:= 1 + mul(ithprime(i),i=1..n);  F:= select(type,map(t->t[1],ifactors(N,easy)[2]),integer);if nops(F) >= 1 then return min(F) fi;  min(map(t->t[1],ifactors(N)[2]))end proc:seq(a(n),n=1..40); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 19 2014
prog: (PARI) a(n) = factor(1 + prod(i=1, n, prime(i)))[1, 1]; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 10 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: One more term from _Michel Marcus_, Dec 10 2013
